title.rendered: Vaughan Carpenter: Should You Install a Pet Door?

content.rendered:
If you’d like to improve both your own quality of life and the happiness of your furry family members, consider installing a pet door at home. As you would with any renovation project, start by reviewing the benefits and potential pitfalls before making any structural changes to your house. Here are the key pros and cons of adding an access door, along with how to connect with top installation professionals when you search for “carpentry services Vaughan”.

The Perks of Having a Pet Door

They’re Time-Savers

Every pet owner knows the scenario. You’re rushing to leave the house for an important meeting, yet Fido’s looking up at you with that “potty time” face. You set everything down, scoot your pup out the backdoor, and then wait for what feels like an eternity for him to finish his business.

Pet bathroom breaks never seem to happen at convenient times. Installing an access door allows your dog to manage his or her own needs so whatever you’re in the middle of never has to be put on hold.

They Keep Your Home Cleaner

Even well-trained dogs have accidents when left home alone for too long. Clean-up is never fun, and some stains and odours are impossible to remove entirely. When you add staying on top of shedding and picking up after other pet messes to the list of tidying chores, finding a way to keep your home cleaner is a must.

Adding a pet door gives your fur family outdoor access not just for relieving themselves, but also for playing and exploring. The more time Fluffy and Fido spend outside, the less shedding, and mischief-making, they’ll do indoors, and you’ll have a neater home to show for it.

They Make Life Better for Your Pets

Pets love freedom, so being able to come and go as they please greatly boosts their well-being. Installing an access door allows them to play in the grass, loll in the sunshine, sniff around outdoors for hours, and then come back inside whenever they like. It’s the best of both worlds for your fur babies! 

Some Negatives To Consider

They Allow Hot and Cold Air To Escape

If you had a pet door in the home you grew up in, this might have been an issue. Fortunately, modern options are energy-efficient, so as long as you buy the right model and it’s professionally installed, they’ll be no significant impact on your utility bills.

They Provide Interior Access to Wildlife

Another worry is that animals other than your own will access your home through a pet door, but there are both low- and high-tech ways to minimize this concern. In most cases, simply closing the door at night solves the issue, as the most common culprits, like raccoons and opossums, are nocturnal.

For the optimal solution day or night, install an electronically activated portal, which uses a sensor on your pet’s collar to open the otherwise-closed door. That way wild animals can’t enter, yet your own have complete access.

Trust Handyman Connection for Quality Installation

Now that you understand the benefits of adding a pet door to your home, as well as how to overcome potential challenges, it’s time to get your project underway. To find the best custom carpentry services in Vaughan, search no further than Handyman Connection!

Whatever your carpentry needs, our skilled professionals are ready to help with any task, large or small. From access door installation to room additions to deck construction and more, the Handyman Connection team provides high-quality results and excellent service. Contact us for an estimate on any home or business repair, renovation, and remodelling work today!
